frameDefinitions: An Influencing_entity, an Influencing_situation, or an Influencing_variable has an influence on a Dependent_entity, Dependent_situation,  or a Dependent_variable.  ''  Compare to Subjective_influence.
This frame involves a Creator making a duplicate, the Copy, of some Original entity.
These words refer to separating a Whole into Parts, or separating one part from another.
A Dodger acts to avoid an oncoming moving Bad_entity.
An Agent displays a Characteristic of a Standard in his or her own way of behaving.
An Agent acts in such a way as to give the incorrect impression to observers that a particular State_of_affairs holds.
frameExamples: More and more doctors realise that diet can <t>influence</t> disease.
The teacher <t>copied</t> the problem onto the blackboard.
I <t>divided</t> the class into groups in alphabetical order .
Mo <t>dodged</t>  the flower pot that Larry threw in disgust.
I guessed he was trying to <t>imitate</t> the movements of a skier
Jordan <t>feigned</t> a love of jazz music to get her phone number .
listRoleDefinitions: A thing or person whose behavior has an effect on an <fen>Dependent_entity</fen>, <fen>Dependent_situation</fen>, or <fen>Dependent_variable</fen>.
An entity, usually a thing, that is influenced in its behavior by an <fen>Influencing_entity</fen> or an <fen>Influencing_situation</fen>.
A scalar variable (with unspecified value) which has  an effect on the <fen>Dependent_entity</fen>, <fen>Dependent_situation</fen>, or <fen>Dependent_variable</fen>.
A situation that whose temporal or other characteristics are influenced by an <fen>Influencing_entity</fen>, <fen>Influencing_situation</fen>, or <fen>Influencing_variable</fen>.
A scalar variable, whose value depends on the behavior of an <fen>Influencing_entity</fen>, a <fen>Influencing_situation</fen>, or an <fen>Influencing_variable</fen>.
A situation whose temporal or other characteristics have an effect on a <fen>Dependent_entity</fen>, <fen>Dependent_situation</fen>, or <fen>Dependent_variable</fen>.
The <fen>Degree</fen> to which the <fen>Influencing_entity</fen> effects the <fen>Dependent_entity</fen>.
The <fen>Time</fen> at which the influence occurs.
The location at which the influencing occurs.
The <fen>Creator</fen> produces the <fen>Copy</fen> based on the <fen>Original</fen>.  It is normally expressed as an External Argument.
The <fen>Original</fen> is the entity which is copied. With verbs it is frequently expressed as an NP Object:
The <fen>Copy</fen> produced by the <fen>Creator</fen> is frequently not expressed. However, when <fen>Copy</fen> does occur, it is usually expressed as the External Argument of verbs:
When the event occurs.
Where the event takes <fen>Place</fen>.
The <fen>Whole</fen> is a single entity or an aggregate of entities which is separated into <fen>Parts</fen>.  It is usually the NP Object of a target verb.
This refers collectively to the Parts resulting from separation of a Whole:
Part-1 is the first of two Parts mentioned. This is most often the Object of a verb.
<fen>Part_2</fen> is the second of two <fen>Parts</fen> mentioned. This is usually a PP Complement. First,
With causative uses of these verbs, an Agent separates or divides something.  The Agent is usually expressed as the External Argument:
The <fen>Cause</fen> is the non-agent that brings about the separation.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the separation occurs.
Where the separation occurs.
The <fen>Dodger</fen> acts to avoid an oncoming <fen>Bad_entity</fen>.
The <fen>Bad_entity</fen> is  the oncoming entity to avoid.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> at which the dodging occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the dodging occurs.
The <fen>Agent</fen> is the person that borrows a <fen>Characteristic</fen> behavior from a <fen>Standard</fen>.
The <fen>Characteristic</fen> is a behavior or property that the <fen>Standard</fen> possesses and which the <fen>Agent</fen> adopts in his or her own behavior.
The <fen>Standard</fen> is the entity that exhibits a certain <fen>Characteristic</fen> that the <fen>Agent</fen> models their own behavior on.
The time at which the imitation occurs.
The location where the <fen>Agent</fen> imitates some entity which acts as a <fen>Standard</fen>.
The <fen>Agent</fen> is the person who acts in a misleading way to create the impression that a <fen>State_of_affairs</fen> holds.
This is the entity which is copied. With verbs it is frequently expressed as an NP Object: Pat <t>falsified</t> <fex name='Original'>the papers</fex>.
The Copy produced by the Creator most commonly occurs as the External Argument of a predicative use of an adjective or noun target: <fex name='Copy'>The painting</fex> is a <t>fake</t>.
The <fen>State_of_affairs</fen> is a an event, a state, or a property that the <fen>Agent</fen> wants others to believe have occurred or hold.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Agent</fen> feigns something.
The place in which the <fen>Agent</fen> feigns something.
listRoleExamples: Much of the acreage in this round is closer to the coastline, and as such has many implications in terms of how <fex>it</fex> could impact upon fish spawning, local bird life, and even the Ministry of Defence in some cases
The Committee is responsible for making recommendations to the Board regarding the group's activities as they impact <fex>on the environment</fex>.
<fex>Factors which</fex> influence the stability of the combination include the softness of the car and the trailer's suspension, plus the balance of the trailer.
The new network file system server line supports database or backup applications running alongside NFS input/output operations without one activity impacting <fex>another</fex>.
This kind of elementary boo-boo would certainly impact <fex>video speed</fex>.
<fex>Pat</fex> photocopied the article.
Pat photocopied <fex>the article</fex>.
<fex>The results</fex> replicate those of an earlier study.
The directors split <fex>the company</fex> in two.
The directors split the company <fex>in two</fex>.
First, separate <fex>the yolks</fex> from the whites.
separate the yolks <fex>from the whites</fex>.
<fex>The researcher</fex> divided subjects into groups.
I divided the prize money among the winners <fex>that night</fex>.
You should separate the yolks from the whites <fex>over the sink</fex>.
<fex>Mo</fex> dodged the flower pot that Larry threw in disgust.
Mo dodged <fex> the flower pot that Larry threw in disgust</fex>.
Mimic Snotlings do n't really think for themselves, <fex>they</fex> merely mimic the actions of Orcs and Goblins around them.
They were all mimicking <fex>my accent</fex>.
The singer says Gwen has copied <fex>her</fex> in many different ways.
A year after <fex>Audrey Seiler</fex> faked her own kidnapping while at college in Wisconsin, her lawyer says she's getting help and paying restitution.
A college student who staged <fex>her own disappearance</fex> last month will try to reach a plea agreement and avoid trial on charges she obstructed officers.
